description: A startup founder uploads a seed‑investment term sheet and receives a plain‑language briefing that explains valuation, equity percentage, pro‑rata rights, and highlights a risky 1x non‑participating liquidation preference with mitigation suggestions.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. Help users understand contracts in plain language, extract key clauses, summarize them, flag risky language, and export a concise briefing in Markdown or PDF.

I just received a seed‑investment term sheet. Can you give me a plain‑language overview of the valuation, the equity I’m giving away, my pro‑rata rights, and point out any risky liquidation‑preference language?
Absolutely! Please upload the term sheet PDF and I’ll get started.

arguments.file_content_base64: JVBERi0xLjQKJcfs... (actual base64 of the PDF content)

messages.content: Got the file. I’ll extract the readable text now.

{"contract_text": "
TERM SHEET

Valuation: Pre‑money valuation of $5,000,000.
Investment Amount: $500,000 for 10% of the Company.
Pro‑Rata Rights: Investor shall have the right to participate in future financing rounds to maintain its ownership percentage.
Liquidation Preference: 1x non‑participating liquidation preference.
Other standard clauses omitted for brevity.
"}
Extracted the text. Now I’ll identify the relevant clauses.

arguments.contract_text:
TERM SHEET

Valuation: Pre‑money valuation of $5,000,000.
Investment Amount: $500,000 for 10% of the Company.
Pro‑Rata Rights: Investor shall have the right to participate in future financing rounds to maintain its ownership percentage.
Liquidation Preference: 1x non‑participating liquidation preference.
Other standard clauses omitted for brevity.

messages.content: {"clauses": [{"type": "valuation","text": "Pre‑money valuation of $5,000,000."},{"type": "equity","text": "$500,000 for 10% of the Company."},{"type": "pro_rata","text": "Investor shall have the right to participate in future financing rounds to maintain its ownership percentage."},{"type": "liquidation_preference","text": "1x non‑participating liquidation preference."}]}
Great, I’ve found the key clauses. I’ll now generate plain‑language summaries for each and look for any risky wording.

arguments.clause_text: Investor shall have the right to participate in future financing rounds to maintain its ownership percentage.

clauses.text: Investor shall have the right to participate in future financing rounds to maintain its ownership percentage.

messages.content: {"summary_text": "The company is valued at $5 million before any money is invested."}
{"summary_text": "The investor will put in $500 k and receive a 10 % ownership stake in the company."}
{"summary_text": "The investor can buy additional shares in later fundraising rounds to keep their 10 % ownership level."}
{"summary_text": "If the company is sold or liquidated, the investor gets back an amount equal to their original $500 k investment before any other shareholders receive money (non‑participating)."}

{"risk_flags": [{"clause_type": "liquidation_preference","risk": "Potentially unfavorable payout structure","explanation": "A 1x non‑participating liquidation preference means the investor recoups their investment first and then does not share in any remaining proceeds, which can limit upside for founders and common shareholders.","mitigation": "Negotiate a lower preference multiple or a participating preference that shares excess proceeds with founders after the preference is satisfied."}]}
Here are the plain‑language summaries and the risk flag I identified. I’ll now compile everything into a downloadable briefing.

summaries.summary_text: The company is valued at $5 million before any money is invested.
The investor will put in $500 k and receive a 10 % ownership stake in the company.
The investor can buy additional shares in later fundraising rounds to keep their 10 % ownership level.
If the company is sold or liquidated, the investor gets back an amount equal to their original $500 k investment before any other shareholders receive money (non‑participating).

risk_flags.explanation: A 1x non‑participating liquidation preference means the investor recoups their investment first and then does not share in any remaining proceeds, which can limit upside for founders and common shareholders.
risk_flags.mitigation: Negotiate a lower preference multiple or a participating preference that shares excess proceeds with founders after the preference is satisfied.

messages.content:
✅ All done! You can download your plain‑language briefing here:

[Download Briefing (Markdown)](https://clauseclear.com/downloads/briefing_2025_12_07_abcdef.md)

The document includes the valuation, equity percentage, pro‑rata rights, and a highlighted risk on the liquidation preference with a suggested mitigation. Let me know if you’d like any further clarification or want to dive deeper into any clause.
